titlestmt.titleproper: Laurance S. Rockefeller papers, Associates, Harry Rand
A Guide to the Laurance S. Rockefeller papers, Associates, Harry Rand FA1224

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-10-01 04:43:32 UTC.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Laurance S. Rockefeller papers, Associates, Harry Rand

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted in accordance with the 2009 donation of the Laurance S. Rockefeller papers. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact an RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The years represented in these files saw an increasing emphasis on environmental concerns in the United States – water pollution, air pollution, the disposal of solid waste, recycling, clean energy, and the need to consciously plan for beauty in the environment – areas in which Laurance Rockefeller was intensely interested. Two of the series in this collection – Citizens Advisory Committee on Environmental Quality (CACEQ) and Utilities – deal extensively with these concerns. Additionally, the Fred Smith series contains numerous publications, reports, and speeches on environmental issues either written or delivered by Fred Smith.

There is one series in this collection which does not deal with environmental issues, but rather with the Rockefeller family itself. Between 1969 and 1971, several conferences were held dealing with the public image of the Rockefeller family, conferences which Harry Rand, as Fred Smith's assistant, attended. The proceedings of these conferences, which were recorded verbatim, offer a glimpse into the relationships between the offices of the brothers as well as into how each office viewed and/or represented its principal.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Laurance S. Rockefeller papers were donated to RAC in 2009 by the LSR estate.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Harry Rand was born on June 2, 1913. He served as an executive in the offices of Rockefeller Family and Associates, as an associate of Laurance S. Rockefeller and working specifically as an assistant to Fred Smith. As a result, these files contain far more information about those with whom Harry Rand worked than they do about Harry Rand himself.
Harry Rand died on October 24, 1998. He is buried in Arlington National Cemetery.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The material in this collection is divided into nine series: Correspondence, General Files, Businessmen and Beautification, Citizens Advisory Committee on Environmental Quality (CACEQ), Fred Smith, Grand Teton National Park, Utilities, Rockefeller Family: Public Relations, and Research Material. Two of the series, the Citizens Advisory Committee on Environmental Quality and Fred Smith, are further divided into subseries. This arrangement reflects the original order in which the material was received.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Rockefeller Archive Center has title, copyright, and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them, and has authority to grant permission to cite and publish archival material from the collection.
